resources.string: \u2022 Added more names in thanks list
\u2022 Fixed log sharing\n \u2022 Also share script file in log\n \u2022 Blacklist Android system from backup list (prevents tar socket error)

• Improvements to logging
 • Ignore tar socket warnings
 • New update-binary should prevent TWRP error 3 issue
 • Should fix an issue of null String while reading backup data

• Probable fix to "android.os.TransactionTooLargeException"
 • Better in app protection to prevent zips from not being made
 • App version is now written in logs
 • App now targets Oreo instead of Pie to potentially avoid some crashes
 • Fixed unexpected '(' in restore process

• [New] Backup verification before zipping
 • Major code refactoring and under-the-hood changes
 • CANCEL button now kills the backup process
 • Fix to "set_progress()" in recovery
 • Probable fix to "Failed to change locale for db"
 • Probable fix to missing updater-script
 • Probable fix to some "Operation not permitted" issues
 • Remove illegal characters from backup name
 • "Share scripts" option should now work properly.

v1.1

 • [New] Backup verification before zipping
 • Major code refactoring and under-the-hood changes
 • CANCEL button now kills the backup process
 • Fix to "set_progress()" in recovery
 • Probable fix to "Failed to change locale for db"
 • Probable fix to missing updater-script
 • Probable fix to some "Operation not permitted" issues
 • Remove illegal characters from backup name
 • "Share scripts" option should now work properly.

 v1.1.1

 • Fixed an issue of no-closing-quote in helper
\u2022 Fixed an issue of no-closing-quote in helper
\u2022 Completely avoid "dumpsys" while backing app permissions\n \u2022 Now app data in tar.gz is unpacked in /data/data\n (probable fix to Operation not permitted issues in Google Pixel)

Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!!

 • Some under the hood changes.
 • Experimental SD card support (with Magisk module)
 • Support for split apks
 • Apks are now unpacked under /data/local/tmp/migrate_cache
 • A new alternative method to calculate app size.
 (probable fix to freezing in calculating app size)
 • Now every migrate zip package has a busybox binary as a fallback
 • Migrate helper gets new Temporary Disable option.
 • Migrate helper gets new Abort option.
\u2022 Fixed a probable crash in Migrate helper.\n

• Minor errors are now suppressed, but recorded in log.
 • Fix icon retention form previous backup.
 • Fix wrong backup duration display.
 • Fixed a bug in error correction mechanism.
 • Probable fix for some apps not being backed up.
 • Fix for error 6 in TWRP for some locales.
 • Fixed a long standing wrong /data space calculation in TWRP.
 • Migrate helper no longer uninstalls app before installing.
 • Added Telegram group link!

From 2.1 to 3.0

 • App is rewritten in Kotlin
 • Many new preferences have been added.
 • Helper app is now available on Google Play.
 • Many fixes in recovery. Support for SAR and Android 10.
 • Added options for backup of app installer, font scale, adb state
 • Set max zip size in preferences.
 • Verification of zips after backup is complete.
 • Many more changes and improvements…

 From 3.0 alpha to 3.0 release

 • Wifi backup is disabled till it becomes stable.
1. SD card support is experimental, and requires a magisk module.
2. The current implementation requires your ROM to support FUSE, which has been replaced by SDCARDFS in recent android versions. FUSE is still in place for legacy support in some ROMs.
3. Because of the above reason, SD card option may or may not work depending on device, ROM and Android version.
4. If the current implementation does not work for you, please wait till the module developer rewrites a new module or I find any other alternative. Thanks for your patience.
To try to get SD card support, download and install the \"ExSDCard Access Enabler\" magisk module and reboot\n This module is made by developer Romain.
Backup zip should be under Migrate directory
System does not have a default ADB connection value. In most cases, this means that it is set at 0 (ADB disabled) Do you want to backup this value as 0?
System does not have a default font scale value. In most cases, this means that it is set at 1.0 Do you want to backup this value as 1.0?
Only for Android Oreo and above (8.0+)
ADB state unknown! Value will not be backed up.
Weird font scale. Value will not be backed up.
No call logs found on the device. Nothing to backup
No SMS messages found on the device. Nothing to backup
No contacts on the device. Nothing to backup
Contacts backup and restore is not recommended if you intend to sign in with Google on your next ROM. Restoring contacts will make unnecessary duplicates of same contact entries.
Long press Cancelling to force stop app.
We need the estimated size to copy the app files. The final package will take much less space than the estimated size due to compression.
Need to read contacts for contacts backup
Need to read SMS for SMS messages backup
Need to read call logs for calls backup
Make sure the destination is mounted and writable.
Backup is not possible because these apps are too big!
Targeted for Stock Android based ROM!

- May fail in Samsung (TouchWiz/One UI), Huawei (EMUI), Xiaomi (MIUI) etc.\n - If you unsure that your ROM is based on stock android or not, better leave the option unchecked.\n - Examples (where these options should work): Lineage OS, AEX, PEX, Carbon, RR etc
Please go to\n Settings -> System -> Languages & input -> Virtual keyboard -> Manage keyboards\n to enable a keyboard
Backup app list does not have the selected keyboard. Please go back to \"Select apps\" page and select the keyboard app.

Contacts : Backup contacts data as vcf
 SMS messages : Backup text messages
 Call logs : Backup call logs. This does not include favourites
 Screen DPI : Backup current screen density
 Default keyboard : Backup the default keyboard selection. Manual selection is required
 App installers : The system treats that apps restored are installed from Play Store or F-droid.
 ADB state : Backup the ADB state (USB debugging)
 Font scale : Size of font is backed up
 
 After ticking a checkbox on an item, click on the item for further options.
You can try going to the main screen of the app -> \"Preferences\" -> Uncheck \"Use new method to calculate size\"
No SD card detected (or not mounted as R/W).

Please make sure that you have mounted an external SD card (if supported by your device)
 Also make sure that you install the "ExSDCard Access Enabler" magisk module.

 [module made by developer Romain.]
SD Card may not be mounted in R/W
External SD card may not be accessible. Make sure that \"ExSDCard Access Enabler\" module is installed in Magisk.\n\n [module made by developer Romain.]
Please wait till the data is completely read. Try again later.
Select installer to be set for all selected apps
To set F-Droid as an installer, you must flash the F-Droid privileged extension.
Due to huge backup size, your backup is being split in
In TWRP, please install all the zips for full restore.
Zip size is greater than the maximum allowed size. Please go to Preferences -> Max. Zip size
Not all files could be combined.
Backup cancelled because system check failed.
A backup with same name already exists. Do you want to overwrite?

App : Backup the apk
 Data : Backup all private data
 Perm : Backup all granular permissions
 
Following is an example of granular permissions from the Google Photos app

\n Previously, selecting Data of an app meant you had to backup the App also. This is no longer the case. Moreover, Migrate now remembers the apps selected for backup. Please note that if you decided not to backup App but Data and/or Perm of an application, then if the app is not already installed before starting restore via Migrate helper, the Data and/or Perm of that app will not be restored.

Apps in white: Normal user apps
 Apps in yellow: System apps which have been updated from Google Play Store or elsewhere. The updated APKs reside in the /data directory and not in system directories.
 Apps in red: System apps which have not been updated.
Backing up and restoring system apps may result in a bootloop. Please proceed with caution.
The app has not been explicitly tested on Android version above Pie (9.0).\n\nPlease submit your feedback on whether the app works or not.
Please make sure that your device is rooted and you have allowed root permission.\n\n If your ROM was pre-rooted, try flashing Magisk.
Reflection is an experimental way of calculating size in Nougat and below. This might provide a better way of calculating size. Recommended: Yes
A new, faster and more reliable method has been added to calculate size of apps before backup.\n\nPlease click Proceed, scroll and select \"Migrate\" then enable \"Permit usage access\"
Please grant storage access to write backups.
If this app has helped you, please consider giving a rating and/or a review.
Only armeabi-v7a, arm64-v8a, x86, x86_64 CPU architectures are currently supported. Please contact via mail to help support your device.
Scroll and select \"Migrate\" and click \"Permit usage access\"!
Select default keyboard from enabled keyboards

Thanks for your interest in helping to improve this app. From now on, all error reports are to be sent in our Telegram group - https://t.me/migrateApp. As such, you will get faster resolution from many people in the group.\n\n By sharing logs, you agree to PUBLICLY share some information.
Not joined in our group yet?
Our Telegram group helps to get quick resolutions to problems.
Please install Telegram and join our group.
Minimizing this screen may decrease backup speed!
Migrate is a vital tool to jump between various custom ROMs with ease.\n\nIt helps you to transfer your apps, data, contacts, sms and much more.
Press Next for a short tour.
Migrate backup packages are TWRP flashable zip files.\n\nA helper app takes over the app restoration process once you boot up your new ROM.
After boot up, you will be automatically prompted to continue restore
PLEASE USE MAGISK. Lineage OS su addon causes unexpected behavior.

This app is still in its infancy. As a result, there might be bugs.

 Migrate is a root based app.

 BY USING THIS APP YOU ACCEPT THAT YOU KNOW THE HAZARDS OF ROOTING AND THEREBY USING A ROOT BASED APP. YOU ACKNOWLEDGE THAT THE DEVELOPER WILL NOT BE HELD RESPONSIBLE FOR BRICKED DEVICES OR DEAD HARDWARE, AND THAT ANY LOSS THAT MIGHT HAPPEN TO YOUR DATA IS COMPLETELY UNINTENTIONAL.

 A nandroid backup is the safest backup method compared to any app based backup method. In case of any issues, please contact the developer.

1. Boot into TWRP
 2. Wipe data (Strongly recommended!)
 3. Flash your new ROM + GApps (optional)
 4. Important: Flash root! Magisk is recommended.

By default, your created backup zip file should be under:
 Internal storage ->
Migrate ->
[backup_name.zip or backup_name -> parts.zip]

 In TWRP main menu, click INSTALL -> navigate to the backup file zip and install it.

 Important: Please do not wipe data after flashing the backup zips.
In some cases, after flashing Magisk, Migrate may falsely detect system_root for non system_root devices. You may get a \"No ROM detected\" error. Please reboot back to TWRP recovery and try again.
1. Reboot to system.\n 2. Complete any GApps/ROM setup.
You should be able to see a notification as shown. Open the notification.
If you don\'t see the notification, open app drawer and open \"Migrate helper\".\n On opening, you should get a screen like this:

RESTORE APPS AND DATA: Give root permission and select the apps and extras to be restored.

 UNINSTALL APP OR FINALIZE RESTORE: Select this to do post restore operations, uninstall the helper and reboot the device.

In case you don\'t have the app, use the inbuilt Android file manager (or download a file manager temporarily from Google Play Store), install the \"helper.apk\" from Internal storage/Migrate directory
Some jobs are usually left after restore. This includes changing the default SMS app (if SMS\'s are restored) from Migrate helper to another app, and also changing the DPI
In Android 10+, after changing the SMS app, the system will force close the Migrate helper app. Please wait for a few seconds before it is automatically restarted.
Finally you will want to uninstall the helper app from the system. You may also want to disable the app to reuse later.

On Android 10+ the Migrate helper, in some cases, may not be able to restart itself. Please open the app manually. You may also be prompted that a different app is being installed in background. Don\'t worry, its a plugin \"watcher\" app which detects that Migrate helper has been force closed, and restarts it. It will be automatically uninstalled by the helper itself.
What is the Perm label in app backup?

Perm means permissions of an app. Migrate can backup the granular permissions granted to an app for Android Marshmallow (6.0) and above.\n Selecting the option will allow you to restore the app permissions when the app is restored.
How is this app different from Titanium Backup?

This app is a ROM migration tool. This app can:
 • Combines all app and data to TWRP flashable zip
 • Backup different extras like contacts, sms, call logs etc
 • Higher portability because you have to carry only few zip files
 • Backups, if needed, can be flashed on another device.
But why not use nandroid backup instead?

Nandroid backup is the safest backup option available. However you cannot restore apps from one nandroid backup to a new ROM.\n This app is necessarily a ROM migration tool. Nandroid backup cannot do that job.
Why can\'t all the apps and data be restored from the recovery itself?

Recovery is a different environment from Android OS. Imaging installing a Windows game from a Linux distro.\n\n So a helper app is injected into the system partition, which fires up on system boot. It takes root permission and automatically restores app and data.
Do I need to download the Migrate app from Play Store to restore the backup zip?
Absolutely not!\n\n All you need is TWRP recovery and that your new ROM be rooted. While flashing backup zip, a helper app is injected into system, which takes up the app restore process.
Is TWRP necessary? Can\'t I restore backup without it?

TWRP recovery is needed to flash the backup zip. Without that, you cannot restore a backup. Other recoveries may work, but is not tested.\n\n Currently Migrate does not support restoring zips from the app itself. But that is something which can be added in future.
Is it necessary to use Magisk?
This app works best with Magisk. SuperSU has not been tested. Lineage OS su addon sometimes work but sometimes give very weird errors. So please use Magisk.
More questions? Feel free to contact on Telegram
Pick up your phone to stop ringing
Access Moto Display with a hand wave
For feedback and support, please contact on our Telegram group. You will get better and faster support from group members.\n\nYou may also choose to personally contact the developer on Telegram.
Open Telegram and select the Migrate group
This app has been copied and is fake.
Please get the original app from BaltiApps by clicking the Install button.
Use new method to calculate size
Enabling this uses StorageStats in Android 8+ and by reflection in lower versions. Disabling this uses terminal shell commands to calculate size.
Clear and press OK to reset to default value
This will automatically select extras like contacts and sms if you had previously backed them up
This will use a separate .icon file to store icons of each app being backed up. If unchecked, app icons will be stored in the .json file.
Check integrity of data backup of each app stored as a tar.gz file
Check integrity of SMS database file stored in the backup
Check integrity of call logs database file stored in the backup
This will perform a basic apk copy and data copy (of this app itself) via Su shell before each backup. Thus checking if backup of other apps will be successful or not.
Extras will be backed up separately even for small backups
Store extras (contacts, sms etc) as a standalone zip file and apps in separate zip files. Applicable only for backups having more than 1 part.
Delete backup zip file if it finished with errors or was corrupted while backup.
Verify if backup zips are corrupted and within the flashable memory constraints of the device.\nHIGHLY RECOMMENDED

This is the maximum allowable size of a backup zip which can be safely flashed via TWRP. This does not mean that zips will actually be of this size, but this value determines the number of parts to be created of the entire backup. Zips may be much smaller than this size to maintain uniformity.
Use Su shell to read keyboard
Root shell will be used to read active keyboards in Extra backups
Ignores the cache directory of apps while backup, thus backups get very small. Although usually safe, you might lose some data of the app.

Migrate maintains a list of files it has backed up in a file \"fileList.txt\" inside the backup zip. This option will make zip verification engine compare the files present in the zip and entries in this file.
Force stopping will attempt to kill the whole app. If you have already pressed Cancel once, please wait for some time.\n\nOn force stopping, you will have to manually delete any backup files made.
Test apk not found or not properly created
Test data (tar.gz) not found or not properly created
This is a formal-informal discussion regarding data privacy and Migrate, some things which users should be aware of. These are subject to change on future updates, as more features are added.

From v3.0 onwards on Google Play edition only, Migrate uses Firebase for crash analytics. No personal data of users is transmitted. Builds of Migrate-NG (available on XDA) do not have crash analytics anymore.
Migrate has been using Google\'s Admob service to display Ads. That remains unchanged.
Data that is read by Migrate

For app backup, the following data are read:
 1. List of installed packages
 2. Path to source apks
 3. Path to data directory
 4. Permissions used
 5. Installer package of apps
 Following are accessed using ROOT permission:
 1. Apks of apps (only stored)
 2. Private data of apps (compressed and stored)
 Apk content of apps are not analysed. Private data of apps are not analysed.


For extra backups, the following are read, only after permission from user:
 1. Contacts data (stored as vcf file)
 2. SMS data (stored as a db file)
 3. Call logs (stored as a db file)
 4. Screen DPI, default keyboard, ADB state, Font scale
 5. Wifi store config file (Android 8.0+)


All data read are stored locally on the device

Sharing in this context refers to voluntary reporting of app logs.

 On sharing logs, you agree to share (publicly, if on Telegram group):

 - Some internal file structure of apps. This (in most cases) does not contain personally identifiable sensitive information.
 - The backup name.
 - Some backup details like number of backup parts.
 - Device information like android version.

 Migrate highly respects privacy of users. As such logs generated during back up of contacts, sms and call logs are NOT RECORDED and not sharable. No intentional attempt is made to identify or make illicit use of personal data of users.

 In any case, you agree that neither the developer, nor is the app responsible for any unintentional breach of privacy. In case you feel that your logs may contain sensitive information, please don't share them. In case you have already shared, please request for their deletion as soon as possible.

As a developer, I want users to understand this point. Again, this is applicable only if you decide to share the logs.

 Migrate uses the linux "tar" utility to compress data files. As such, tar prints out file names it has processed, and this also helps to identify if there are any errors in the process. Contents of the files are not printed.

 Usually it is not possible to detect personally identifiable information from cryptic output of tar files. But in some rare cases, developers may not follow proper practices and place information on the file name itself. Example: a chat app storing chat preferences with a participant as a file with name as the phone number of the participant. In this case, tar will print the name of the file, thus exposing the phone number. This is just one example.

 Migrate cannot take responsibility of putting a custom filter for each of the millions of apps out there, fearing that they don't by mistake leak any information.

 Again this is a VERY rare case, and usually always goes unnoticed. This happened with previous versions of Migrate and I got suggestion from few users that this be known to everyone.
 You can continue to use Migrate as you have done.

As discussed previously, if you think your backup contains really sensitive data, please do not share logs. Nothing leaves your device if you do not voluntarily share logs. However, also note that without logs it becomes nearly impossible to provide any kind of support.\n\n Alternatively, you can choose to not share \"Progress log\". The \"Error log\" and other options are usually most important.
That\'s all. Enjoy using the app. Feel free to contact me on Telegram.\n- SayantanRC
Huge thanks to Stephen (stericdroid) for allowing me to liberally use his busybox builds
Without topjohnwu\'s Magisk, this app would not be possible. I learned a lot from Magisk installer scripts.
